ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]The key to life? Recognize and use the freedom you already have. #TEDTalks

ns2:group.ns2:title: The key to life? Recognize and use the freedom you already have. #TEDTalks
ns2:group.ns2:description: The real lever of a meaningful life isnâ€™t intelligence or hustle â€” itâ€™s personal agency, says Cate Hall, former Supreme Court attorney and once the worldâ€™s top-ranked female poker player. Sharing her journey from the throes of addiction to leading a multibillion-dollar foundation, Hall shares tactical wisdom for increasing your ability to see and act on life's hidden degrees of freedom, showing how even the most trapped among us can discover a path to fulfillment.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Retail loyalty reinvented by Flybuys | Retail Insights with AWS | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Retail loyalty reinvented by Flybuys | Retail Insights with AWS | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Join us for a captivating conversation with Anna Lee, CEO of Flybuys, Australiaâ€™s leading coalition loyalty program, as we uncover how Flybuys is revolutionizing customer experience through data-driven innovation and personalized engagement. In this episode, hosts Lucy Moffat (Head of Cross Industry, ANZ) and Isha Dalal (Enterprise Solutions Architect) take you behind the scenes of Flybuysâ€™ journey, showcasing how everyday shopping is being transformed into truly rewarding experiences for millions across Australia. Discover how Flybuys has grown from a classic loyalty program to a vibrant part of daily life, creating moments of delight and connecting people to their favourite retail partners.
Discover how Flybuys is evolving far beyond pointsâ€”using advanced analytics to deliver hyper-personalized offers, reimagining routine shopping into magical moments, and helping Australians maximize value in their everyday lives across a vast network of retail partners like Coles, Wesfarmers, Kmart, and Bunnings. Anna shares candid insights into the journey of digitizing member engagement, uplifting data and communications platforms, and building a customer-first culture through technology, people empowerment, and agile collaboration.
Visit Flybuys: experience.flybuys.com.au
Hear firsthand how personalized data, technology, and member-centric design are putting Flybuys at the heart of millions of Australiansâ€™ daily lives.

We offer the greatest choice of innovative cloud capabilities and expertise, on the most extensive global infrastructure with industry-leading security, reliability, and performance.

ns2:group.ns2:title: Build beautiful frontends with OpenAI Codex
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Codexâ€™s multimodal abilities can help you design, iterate, and build beautiful frontends for your apps.
Channing Conger and Romain Huet show you how to use Codex cloud as your front-end design partner to build the perfect UI for your app.
Timestamps:
00:00 Intro 00:50 Whiteboarding design ideas 01:43 Creating Codex tasks from your phone 02:16 Sketching a new feature 03:00 Different ways to use multimodal features 04:06 Channingâ€™s favorite examples 05:36 Checking in on our tasks 07:30 What Channing and team are building next

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Ellie Golden Life]therapy dogs surprise marathon runners
[Amazon Web Services]Lionâ€™s AI strategy in B2B commerce | Retail Insights with AWS | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Lionâ€™s AI strategy in B2B commerce | Retail Insights with AWS | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Join us for an insightful conversation with Robb Simpson, Group Digital & Data Director at Lion, one of Australasia's most iconic beverage companies, as we explore how a century-old brewery is leading the charge in B2B digital transformation and data commercialization.
Watch full episode here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gGfFy1IccwI&list=PLhr1KZpdzukevIWxQPbYmL9XWyBgj9xbz
In this episode, hosts Isha Dalal (Enterprise Solutions Architect at AWS) and Andrew Bremner (Head of Retail, Travel & Hospitality) dive deep into the rapidly evolving B2B commerce landscape, where digital sales have surged from just 13% in 2019 to 80% today, with the global market racing toward $48 trillion by 2030. Discover how Lion is transforming from a traditional beverage manufacturer into a data-driven powerhouse that creates value for retailers, distributors, and venues across Australia, New Zealand, and the US.
Robb shares valuable insights on AI Strategy, commercializing data to unlock new revenue streams, implementing customer-centric design in B2B environments, and bridging the gap between technology teams and market realities. Explore how Lion's approach to data commercialization is turning every transaction into actionable intelligence, creating win-win partnerships that go far beyond traditional supplier-retailer relationships. From their portfolio of beloved brands like Tooheys, XXXX, James Squire, and Steinlager to their cutting-edge B2B digital platforms, see how Lion is setting new standards for what's possible in beverage industry innovation.
Whether you're a retailer looking to enhance B2B partnerships, a technology leader interested in data commercialization strategies, or a business professional exploring digital transformation in traditional industries, this episode offers valuable insights into the future of B2B commerce and customer-centric innovation.
Visit Lion: https://www.lionco.com/ Learn more about AWS Retail solutions: http://go.aws/4objzDU

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]How to Use Your Muscles â€” or Risk Losing Them (W/ Bonnie Tsui) | How to Be a Better Human | TED

ns2:group.ns2:title: How to Use Your Muscles â€” or Risk Losing Them (W/ Bonnie Tsui) | How to Be a Better Human | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Did you know that you start losing muscle mass as soon as the age of 30? Author and surfer Bonnie Tsui explores how to build strength as you age with Chris Duffy, host of the "How to Be a Better Human" podcast. Watch as Bonnie tries to teach Chris how to surf while weaving in lessons on the benefits of weightlifting, maintaining mobility and adding more movement into your life.
This episode is part of the How to Be a Better Human Bonus Videos series. You can find the extended interview on the TED Audio Collective YouTube Channel.
Follow Host: Chris Duffy (Instagram: @chrisiduffy | https://chrisduffycomedy.com/) Guest: Bonnie Tsui (Instagram: @bonnietsui8 | https://www.bonnietsui.com/)

ns2:group.ns2:description:

Choose the perfect instance for your workload: C8i: Ideal for compute-intensive applications M8i: Perfect for large in-memory databases R8i: Optimized for memory-intensive workloads

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Commonwealth Realm]Zelda 40th Anniversary Revealing New Zelda Horror?

ns2:group.ns2:title: Zelda 40th Anniversary Revealing New Zelda Horror?
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Zelda has been famous for its darker horror elements since Ocarina of Time. So will the Zelda 40th Anniversary reveal proper Zelda Darkness and Horror both in a remake and the next game?
#nintendoswitch2 #zelda #ocarinaoftime
Timestamps: 00:00 - New Zelda Horror for Zelda 40th? 02:00 - Tears of the Kingdom was dark, but not Ocarina level. 04:00 - Majora's Mask after Ocarina Remake? 06:00 - Next Zelda Game with Darker themes 08:00 - Why The Depths missed the mark

ns2:group.ns2:title: Going Viral Taught Me the Internet Is Broken â€” but Fixable | Deja Foxx | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Digital strategist Deja Foxx went viral for speaking up at a town meeting â€” and then learned the harsh cost of being in social mediaâ€™s crosshairs. She welcomes us to the â€œgirl internet,â€ a growing ecosystem of women-led platforms that prioritize privacy, community and respect. "Weâ€™re building a new, better way of being online, no matter your generation or your gender," she says. (Recorded at TED2025 on April 10, 2025)

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [The Verge]Does anyone play Guitar Hero anymore? | Version History

ns2:group.ns2:title: Does anyone play Guitar Hero anymore? | Version History
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Millions of basements have fake plastic guitars in them thanks to the 2005 smash hit Guitar Hero. Chris Grant and Ash Parrish join David Pierce to rock out with a game created over a matter of months by a niche developer and a peripheral manufacturer, fueled by word-of-mouth and viral videos on a nascent YouTube. You probably donâ€™t play Guitar Hero anymore, but you might still find it in surprising places. #VersionHistory #Podcast #Technology
0:00 Introduction: Become a Rock Star with Guitar Hero 00:54 Meet the Hosts: David, Ash, and Chris 01:04 Personal Guitar Hero Stories 05:24 The Origins of Guitar Hero 05:37 Harmonix and Red Octane: The Perfect Match 14:18 The First Guitar Hero Game: Development and Challenges 19:03 E3 2005: Guitar Hero's Big Break 25:11 The Game's Immediate Success and Impact 35:29 The Rapid Expansion: Sequels and Acquisitions 37:14 Guitar Hero vs. Rock Band: The Ultimate Showdown 38:23 E3 2007: The Rock Band Debut 40:36 The Rise and Fall of Guitar Hero 43:26 The Legacy of Music Games 46:47 The Future of Rhythm Games 48:50 Guitar Hero's Place in History
